headline: Assessing Walmart’s (WMT) Valuation After Earnings Beat Buyback Plan Dividend Hike And Tech Investments
summary: Walmart (WMT) just paired a fresh earnings beat with a higher dividend, a new US$30b share repurchase plan, and ongoing bets on e-commerce, advertising, and automation, giving investors several moving pieces to assess at once. See our latest analysis for Walmart. At a share price of US$125.81, Walmart has paired a 17.6% 3 month share price return with a 35.6% 1 year total shareholder return. This suggests momentum has been building around its earnings beat, dividend lift, and fresh US$30b...

headline: As Walmart Raises Its Dividend 5%, Should You Buy WMT Stock?
summary: Walmart's latest dividend increase, Q4 revenue growth, and global e-commerce expansion confirm the business still earns its Dividend King status, but WMT has a high forward earnings multiple and a stock price already above the average analyst target.

content.title: As Walmart Raises Its Dividend 5%, Should You Buy WMT Stock?
content.summary: Walmart's latest dividend increase, Q4 revenue growth, and global e-commerce expansion confirm the business still earns its Dividend King status, but WMT has a high forward earnings multiple and a stock price already above the average analyst target.

headline: Walmart rolls out Scintilla In-Store across stores

content.title: Walmart rolls out Scintilla In-Store across stores
content.summary: The application, the newest addition to Walmart’s Scintilla portfolio, combines tools, real-time store data, performance metrics, and supplier-assigned tasks into a single interface.

thumbnail.caption: Walmart Data Ventures said future updates will introduce AI-based prioritisation and tighter links with in-store systems to improve task efficiency and support consistent product availability across omnichannel shopping.

headline: California seeks injunction to stop Amazon's alleged stifling of price competition
summary: The ‌state's attorney general, Rob Bonta, sought a preliminary injunction in his 3-1/2-year-old antitrust lawsuit against Amazon, ​which also seeks to recoup ill-gotten profits.  "Amazon’s goal is to insulate itself from price competition by preventing lower retail prices in the market," Bonta said in a heavily redacted filing in the California Superior Court in San Francisco.  "Amazon ‌tells vendors what prices it ⁠wants to see to maintain its own profitability."

content.title: California seeks injunction to stop Amazon's alleged stifling of price competition
content.summary: The ‌state's attorney general, Rob Bonta, sought a preliminary injunction in his 3-1/2-year-old antitrust lawsuit against Amazon, ​which also seeks to recoup ill-gotten profits.  "Amazon’s goal is to insulate itself from price competition by preventing lower retail prices in the market," Bonta said in a heavily redacted filing in the California Superior Court in San Francisco.  "Amazon ‌tells vendors what prices it ⁠wants to see to maintain its own profitability."

headline: 3 Dividend ETFs That Actually Protect Against Market Crashes
summary: The stock market has had a great start to 2026, and its upward trend has continued so far. However, it doesn’t mean that the rally will keep going. There’s a risk of AI bubble collapse, a slow labor market, and geopolitical issues that could impact the stock market. headline: How Investors May Respond To Walmart (WMT) E-commerce Strength And New US$30 Billion Buyback Plan
summary: In recent days, Walmart reported full-year 2026 results showing higher sales, revenue, and net income, approved a US$0.99 per-share annual dividend for fiscal 2027, completed a US$16.14 billion buyback program and authorized a new US$30 billion repurchase plan, while brands like Smash Kitchen and Catalyst Pet announced nationwide product launches at its stores. Taken together, these updates highlight Walmart’s effort to pair technology-led e-commerce growth and an expanding product ecosystem...

content.title: How Investors May Respond To Walmart (WMT) E-commerce Strength And New US$30 Billion Buyback Plan
content.summary: In recent days, Walmart reported full-year 2026 results showing higher sales, revenue, and net income, approved a US$0.99 per-share annual dividend for fiscal 2027, completed a US$16.14 billion buyback program and authorized a new US$30 billion repurchase plan, while brands like Smash Kitchen and Catalyst Pet announced nationwide product launches at its stores. Taken together, these updates highlight Walmart’s effort to pair technology-led e-commerce growth and an expanding product ecosystem...
